title: Daguerre: the birth of photography = Daguerre: ou la naissan
brief_description: Traces the early history of photography, concentrating on the achievements of Joseph Niepce, who in 1822 invented the first permanent photograph. Louis Daguerre, who in 1838, developed a process for recording photographs on polished metal plates is shown with other innovators in the field.
